item.title: Stolen Ticketmaster data from Snowflake attacks briefly for sale again
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Arkana Security extortion gang briefly listed over the weekend what appeared to be newly stolen Ticketmaster data but is instead the data stolen during the 2024 Snowflake data theft attacks. [...]

item.title: Over 84,000 Roundcube instances vulnerable to actively exploited flaw
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 84,000 instances of the Roundcube webmail software are vulnerable to CVE-2025-49113, a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability with a publicly available exploit. [...]

item.title: Google patched bug leaking phone numbers tied to accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability allowed researchers to brute-force any Google account's recovery phone number simply by knowing a their profile name and an easily retrieved partial phone number, creating a massive risk for phishing and SIM-swapping attacks. [...]

item.title: SentinelOne shares new details on China-linked breach attempt
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SentinelOne has shared more details on an attempted supply chain attack by Chinese hackers through an IT services and logistics firm that manages hardware logistics for the cybersecurity firm. [...]

item.title: Linux Foundation unveils decentralized WordPress plugin manager
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A collective of former WordPress developers and contributors backed by the Linux Foundation has launched the FAIR Package Manager, a new and independent distribution system for trusted WordPress plugins and themes. [...]

item.title: Sensata Technologies says personal data stolen by ransomware gang
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Sensata Technologies is warning former and current employees it suffered a data breach after concluding an investigation into an April ransomware attack. [...]

item.title: Designing Blue Team playbooks with Wazuh for proactive incident response
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Wazuh
item.description: Blue Team playbooks are essential—but tools like Wazuh take them to the next level. From credential dumping to web shells and brute-force attacks, see how Wazuh strengthens real-time detection and automated response. [...]

item.title: Grocery wholesale giant United Natural Foods hit by cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: United Natural Foods (UNFI), North America's largest publicly traded wholesale distributor, was forced to shut down some systems following a recent cyberattack. [...]

item.title: New Mirai botnet infect TBK DVR devices via command injection flaw
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new variant of the Mirai malware botnet is exploiting a command injection vulnerability in TBK DVR-4104 and DVR-4216 digital video recording devices to hijack them. [...]

item.title: Malware found in NPM packages with 1 million weekly downloads
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A significant supply chain attack hit NPM after 15 popular Gluestack packages with over 950,000 weekly downloads were compromised to include malicious code that acts as a remote access trojan (RAT). [...]

item.title: Malicious npm packages posing as utilities delete project directories
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two malicious packages have been discovered in the npm JavaScript package index, which masquerades as useful utilities but, in reality, are destructive data wipers that delete entire application directories. [...]

item.title: Microsoft shares script to restore inetpub folder you shouldn’t delete
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released a PowerShell script to help restore an empty 'inetpub' folder created by the April 2025 Windows security updates if deleted. As Microsoft previously warned, this folder helps mitigate a high-severity Windows Process Activation privilege escalation vulnerability. [...]
